qas.question: What famous soccer stadium is in Mexico City?
How many fans does Azteca Stadium hold?
What is the largest stadium in Latin America?
What year did Mexico most recently host the World Cup?
What division are the Mexico City soccer teams in?

context: Association football is the country's most popular and most televised franchised sport. Its important venues in Mexico City include the <a0_0><a2_0>Azteca Stadium<a2_0/><a0_0/>, home to the Mexico national football team and giants América, which can seat <a1_0>91,653<a1_0/> fans, making it the biggest stadium in Latin America. The Olympic Stadium in Ciudad Universitaria is home to the football club giants Universidad Nacional, with a seating capacity of over 52,000. The Estadio Azul, which seats 33,042 fans, is near the World Trade Center Mexico City in the Nochebuena neighborhood, and is home to the giants Cruz Azul. The three teams are based in Mexico City and play in the <a4_0>First<a4_0/> Division; they are also part, with Guadalajara-based giants Club Deportivo Guadalajara, of Mexico's traditional "Big Four" (though recent years have tended to erode the teams' leading status at least in standings). The country hosted the FIFA World Cup in 1970 and <a3_0>1986<a3_0/>, and Azteca Stadium is the first stadium in World Cup history to host the final twice.
